maml:description.maml:para: Creates or opens a memory image file in system memory, or creates a memory image file from an existing file.
Creates or opens a memory image file in system memory, or creates a memory image file from an existing file.

Memory-mapped files allow programmers to work with extremely large files because memory can be managed concurrently, and they provide complete random access to a file without requiring a seek. Memory-mapped files can also be shared among multiple processes.
A memory-mapped file can be associated with an optional name that allows the memory-mapped file to be shared with other processes.
A name to assign to the memory-mapped file, or null for a MemoryMappedFile that you do not intend to share across processes.
The maximum size, in bytes, to allocate to the memory-mapped file.
Creates a new empty memory mapped file or opens an existing memory mapped file if one exists.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
A name to assign to the memory-mapped file, or null for a MemoryMappedFile that you do not intend to share across processes.
The maximum size, in bytes, to allocate to the memory-mapped file.
One of the enumeration values that specifies the type of access allowed to the memory-mapped file. The default is ReadWrite.
A bitwise combination of enumeration values that specifies memory allocation options for the memory-mapped file.
A value that specifies whether a handle to the memory-mapped file can be inherited by a child process. The default is None.
Creates a new empty memory mapped file or opens an existing memory mapped file if one exists.

Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: ---- Example 1: Create a new memory-mapped file. (Default) ----

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a memory-mapped file that has the specified capacity in system memory.

command:example.maml:title: --------- EXAMPLE 2: Create a new memory-mapped file. ---------

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a memory-mapped file that has the specified capacity and access type in system memory.

maml:description.maml:para: Opens an existing named memory-mapped file in system memory.
Opens an existing memory-mapped file that has the specified name, access rights, and inheritability in system memory.
The name of the memory-mapped file.
One of the enumeration values that specifies the access rights to apply to the memory-mapped file.
One of the enumeration values that specifies whether a handle to the memory-mapped file can be inherited by a child process. The default is None.
The name of the memory-mapped file.
One of the enumeration values that specifies the access rights to apply to the memory-mapped file.
One of the enumeration values that specifies whether a handle to the memory-mapped file can be inherited by a child process. The default is None.
One of the enumeration values that specifies the access rights to apply to the memory-mapped file.
The name of the memory-mapped file.

command:example.maml:title: EXAMPLE 1: Opens an existing memory-mapped file that has the specified name in system memory.

dev:remarks.maml:para: The following example opens a memory-mapped file named `Test` that has already been created.

command:example.maml:title: EXAMPLE 2: Opens an existing memory-mapped file that has the specified name and access rights in system memory.

dev:remarks.maml:para: The following example opens a memory-mapped file named `Test` that has already been created.

command:example.maml:title: EXAMPLE 3: Opens an existing memory-mapped file that has the specified name, access rights, and inheritability in system memory.
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Open-MemoryMappedFile -Name "Test" -MemoryMappedFileRights FullControl -HandleInheritability Inheritable
SafeMemoryMappedFileHandle -------------------------- Microsoft.Win32.SafeHandles.SafeMemoryMappedFileHandle

dev:remarks.maml:para: The following example opens a memory-mapped file named `Test` that has already been created.

maml:description.maml:para: Writes data to the MemoryMappedFile.
The Out-MemoryMappedFile function retrieves a MemoryMappedViewStream of a memory mapped file and writes a value to the stream for interprocess communication.
Represents a memory-mapped file.
The string to write to the stream.
Specifies whether to add content to the end of a resource. Otherwise, the content is replaced with the value.
Specifies whether to add content to the end of a resource. Otherwise, the content is replaced with the value.
Represents a memory-mapped file.
The string to write to the stream.

maml:description.maml:para: Read data from the MemoryMappedFile.
The Read-MemoryMappedFile function retrieves a MemoryMappedViewStream of a memory mapped file and reads the value from the stream for interprocess communication.
Represents a memory-mapped file.
Represents a memory-mapped file.

command:example.maml:title: --------- EXAMPLE 1: Read a memory mapped file stream. ---------

dev:remarks.maml:para: The following example obtains a MemoryMappedViewStream of a memory-mapped file and read the value from the stream for inter-process communication.

maml:description.maml:para: Releases the resources used by the MemoryMappedFile.
The Remove-MemoryMappedFile function releases the resources used by the MemoryMappedFile.
Represents a memory-mapped file.
Represents a memory-mapped file.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Releases all resources used by the MemoryMappedFile.

maml:description.maml:para: Saves the MemoryMappedFile to a specified path.
The Save-MemoryMappedFile function saves the MemoryMappedFile to a specified path.
